page.title: 13Village Life.
page.content: On the next few pages we have tried to describe some of the activities _ clubs and societies, which are active in the villages. {1.The Bowls Club. In 1934 people were playing bowls on the Pond Farm lawn.In 1936 they moved up to the Mens Club.After a while Mr. Fred Chapman leased them a piece of his land to use and an excellent bowling green was built. There is now a club house.This year it is going to be extended, because there are more members.To join costs Â£10 for the season.This year they have started to wear white tops and grey skirts as uniform.Mrs Norden use to take the ladies team.Cambridgeshire and Steeple Bumpstead played against each other and raised Â£50 to buy mats recently. The Club is a very successful one.
